wikitext.*:
'''Bernie Zuber''' ([[1933]]-[[2005]]) was an author, artist and [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] [[Tolkien fandom|fan]], involved in several Tolkien-related projects.<ref>Victor Koman, [http://komansense.blogspot.com/2005/10/bernie-zuber-1933-2005.html Bernie Zuber â€¢ 1933-2005] at [http://komansense.blogspot.com/ Komansense.blogspot.com] (accessed 30 December 2011)</ref> He founded The Tolkien Fellowships and was editor and publisher of its journal ''The Westmarch Chronicle''. He also acted as co-director (with his wife Teny) of fan relations in order to promote [[Ralph Bakshi]]'s [[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)|''The Lord of the Rings'']].<ref>Bart Andrews, "Notes from Middle-Hollywood", in ''[[The Tolkien Quiz Book (by Bart Andrews)|The Tolkien Quiz Book]]''</ref>
